etymologies: mid 16th century (denoting a soldier in charge of a bombard, an early form of cannon): from French, from Old French bombarde ‘cannon’ (see bombard)

definitions: a member of a bomber crew in the US Air Force responsible for sighting and releasing bombs.
shortDefinitions: member of bomber crew in US Air Force responsible for sighting and releasing bombs

definitions: a rank of noncommissioned officer in certain Canadian and British artillery regiments, equivalent to corporal.
shortDefinitions: rank of noncommissioned officer in certain Canadian and British artillery regiments
